summary: This document is a chain of emails between attorneys Mariann Wang and Gloria Allred, and an Assistant U.S. Attorney, discussing the scheduling of interviews for multiple clients who are potential victims of Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell. The emails contain summaries of the clients' allegations, including timeframes, locations, and interactions with Epstein, Maxwell, and others, including Prince Andrew.

persons.name: Mariann Wang
persons.context: Attorney from Cuti Hecker Wang LLP representing potential victims, coordinating with Gloria Allred and the U.S. Attorney's office to schedule client interviews.

persons.name: Gloria Allred
persons.context: High-profile attorney from Allred, Maroko & Goldberg, co-counsel with Mariann Wang, involved in scheduling victim interviews with the U.S. Attorney's office.

persons.name: Maurene
persons.context: Assistant U.S. Attorney for the Southern District of New York, the primary point of contact for the attorneys regarding victim interviews and information requests about case evidence like photographs.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Central figure in the case; the emails reference multiple clients alleging abuse by him in various locations and timeframes from 2000-2017.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Frequently mentioned in client allegations; described as interacting with victims, leaving voicemails, and being involved in the abuse.

persons.name: Prince Andrew
persons.context: Mentioned in one client's allegation of a final interaction with Epstein in 2010 that included an interaction with him at a townhouse.

persons.name: Diane Aldrich
persons.context: Executive Assistant to Gloria Allred, who sent a Zoom conference link for a scheduled call.

connections.description: Co-counsels working together to represent multiple clients who are potential victims in the Epstein/Maxwell case.
Attorney coordinating with Assistant U.S. Attorney to schedule victim interviews and request information about case evidence.
Attorney communicating with prosecutor to arrange a call and facilitate victim interviews for the investigation.
Client allegations describe Maxwell as being involved in the abuse and operations related to Epstein.
One client allegation references an interaction with Prince Andrew occurring during a final meeting with Epstein.
Client summaries allege direct interactions with Maxwell, including her leaving voicemails and being involved in incidents.

events.title: Scheduled Attorney-Prosecutor Call
events.description: A Zoom call was scheduled between attorneys Mariann Wang, Gloria Allred, and AUSA Maurene to discuss questions prior to scheduling victim interviews.

events.title: Scheduled Client Interviews
events.description: A date was proposed for interviewing clients whose sessions had been adjourned a few weeks prior.

events.title: Alleged Abuse Incidents
events.description: The document lists multiple alleged incidents involving clients and Epstein/Maxwell spanning from late 2000 to November 2017, occurring in New York, Florida, Paris, California, and Washington, D.C.

events.title: Alleged Interaction with Prince Andrew
events.description: One client alleged a final interaction with Epstein in 2010 that included an interaction with Prince Andrew at a townhouse.

locations: Southern District of New York (1 St. Andrew's Plaza)
keyFacts: Attorneys Mariann Wang and Gloria Allred were representing multiple clients alleging abuse by Jeffrey Epstein and involvement by Ghislaine Maxwell.
Client allegations span from approximately 2000 to 2017 and involve incidents in New York, Florida, Paris, California, and Washington, D.C.
One specific allegation mentions an interaction with Prince Andrew during a final meeting with Epstein in 2010.
The attorneys were in communication with the U.S. Attorney's Office (AUSA Maurene) to schedule victim interviews and seek clarification on evidence, specifically regarding photographs.
The email chain reveals the procedural coordination between victim attorneys and federal prosecutors in the ongoing Epstein/Maxwell investigation.
